articles.title: Trump blasts Putin as "absolutely crazy" as Russia targets Ukraine with massive wave of drones and missiles
articles.description: Ukraine says Russia launched its biggest drone strike to date after Trump called Putin crazy for stepping up his offensive and "needlessly killing a lot of people."
articles.content: Kyiv, Ukraine — Russia launched its biggest drone attack on Ukraine overnight since the more than three-year war began, a Ukrainian official said Monday. President Trump said Russian leader Vladimir Putin had gone "absolutely crazy" in stepping up hi... [6805 chars]

articles.author: CP24 Toronto
articles.title: Donald Trump pardoning Virginia sheriff convicted on bribery charges
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said Monday that he is pardoning a former Virginia sheriff who was sentenced to 10 years in prison after a jury convicted him on federal bribery charges for deputizing several businessmen in exchange for cash payments.
articles.content:
U.S. President Donald Trump said Monday that he is pardoning a former Virginia sheriff who was sentenced to 10 years in prison after a jury convicted him on federal bribery charges for deputizing several businessmen in exchange for cash payments.

articles.author: Salon
articles.title: Keep Calm and Stay Canadian
articles.description: Trump jokes about annexing Canada, so King Charles makes a visit. Canadians look for door #3: themselves.
articles.content:
King Charles III arrived in Canada’s capital city, Ottawa, on Monday. This is his first trip to Canada since ascending the throne, personally invited by Prime Minister Mark Carney to speak about the agenda for the new season of Parliament.

articles.author: The Guardian
articles.title: Tourists from countries badly hit by Trump tariffs are staying away from US
articles.description: Data from hotel site Trivago shows fewer US bookings by holidaymakers from Canada, Japan, Mexico and Germany
articles.content:
Holidaymakers in countries hit the hardest by Donald Trump’s trade tariffs are taking the US off their list for trips abroad, according to online travel booking data.

articles.content:

articles.description: The Trump administration has ordered US embassies around the world to pause scheduling new visa interviews for foreign students.

articles.description: A wildlife inspector said the destruction of sand dunes at a beach beside Donald Trump's luxury Irish hotel was unlikely to be halted by a simple fencing project.

articles.description: Adidas, Shein, are among 10 companies that will raise their prices as Donald Trump tariffs weigh on US imports amid the ongoing trade war between the United States and other world nations.
articles.content:
Adidas, Shein, Walmart, and Best Buy are among the 10 companies which are set to increase their product prices as President Donald Trump's baseline tariffs and charges on most Chinese imports weigh on the US imports, reported the news portal CNN.
